assertions.name: attributeContains

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS/Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.descr: The attribute name

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected contained value of the attribute to check.

parameters.name: message
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.descr: Checks if the given attribute of an element contains the expected value.

assertions.name: attributeEquals
assertions.descr: Checks if the given attribute of an element has the expected value.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS/Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.descr: The attribute name

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected value of the attribute to check.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: attributeMatches
assertions.descr: Checks if the given attribute of an element matches a regular expression.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS/Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties

parameters.name: attribute
parameters.descr: The attribute name

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected value of the attribute to check.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: cssProperty
assertions.descr: Checks if the specified css property of a given element has the expected value.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: cssProperty
parameters.descr: The CSS property.

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected value of the css property to check.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: domPropertyContains
assertions.descr:
Checks if the specified DOM property of a given element has the expected value. For all the available DOM element properties, consult the [Element doc at MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/element).

Several properties can be specified (either as an array or command-separated list). Nightwatch will check each one for presence.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: domProperty
parameters.descr: The DOM property name.

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected value of the DOM property to check.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: domPropertyEquals
assertions.descr: Checks if the specified DOM property of a given element has the expected value. For all the available DOM element properties, consult the [Element doc at MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/element). If the result value is JSON object or array, a deep equality comparison will be performed.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: domProperty
parameters.descr: The DOM property name.

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected value of the DOM property to check.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: elementsCount
assertions.descr: Checks if the number of elements specified by a selector is equal to a given value.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the elements. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: elementPresent
assertions.descr: Checks if the given element exists in the DOM.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: enabled
assertions.descr: Checks if the given element is enabled (as indicated by the 'disabled' attribute).

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: hasClass
assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element has the specified CSS class. Multiple css classes can be specified either as an array or a space-delimited string.

In case the expected value is a space delimited string, the order is not taken into account - each value will individually be checked against.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: className
parameters.descr: The CSS class to look for.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: hasAttribute
assertions.descr:
Checks if the given element contains the specified DOM attribute. Multiple attributes can be specified either as an array or a space-delimited string.

In case the expected value is a space delimited string, the order is not taken into account - each value will individually be checked against.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: expectedAttribute
parameters.descr: The DOM attribute to look for.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: selected
assertions.descr: Checks if the given element is selected.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: value
assertions.descr: Checks if the given form element's value equals the expected value.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: expectedText
parameters.descr: The expected text.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: valueContains
assertions.descr: Checks if the given form element's value contains the expected value.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: expectedText
parameters.descr: The expected text.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: visible
assertions.descr: Checks if the given element is visible on the page.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS / Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: containsText
assertions.descr: Checks if the given element contains the specified text.

parameters.name: definition
parameters.descr: The selector (CSS/Xpath) used to locate the element. Can either be a string or an object which specifies element properties.

parameters.name: expectedText
parameters.descr: The text to look for.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: title
assertions.descr: Checks if the page title equals the given value.

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected page title.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: urlContains
assertions.descr: Checks if the current URL contains the given value.

parameters.name: expectedText
parameters.descr: The value expected to exist within the current URL.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.

assertions.name: urlEquals
assertions.descr: Checks if the current url equals the given value.

parameters.name: expected
parameters.descr: The expected url.

parameters.name: msg
parameters.descr: Optional log message to display in the output. If missing, one is displayed by default.
